snippet.title: Why Talented Master Watchmakers Dedicate Their Lives To The Art
snippet.description: In the world of high-end watchmaking there are men and women who make the pursuit of horology something intellectual and very interesting as opposed to the mere collection of luxury status items. Watchmaking has always been at heart a scientific endeavor, but one that has been mixed with art forms as well as the high-profile nature of producing [...] read »

snippet.title: 5 Ways To Find Work When There Are No Jobs
snippet.description: The premise of a new book by Chicago career coach and management training consultant Roger Wright: there is plenty of work out there, but not necessarily a lot of jobs with benefits and a steady paycheck. The book, released in Feb., is called Finding Work When There are No Jobs. [...]

snippet.title: Video: Scott Cook on How Technology Can Revolutionize Education
snippet.description: Video In this video from the "Revolutions in Progress" session at Techonomy 2011 in Tucson, Ariz., Scott Cook, Founder and Chairman of Intuit, discusses how technology can revolutionize education in the same way it has transformed the music and entertainment industries. Digital technology has given musicians and artists a global reach [...] read »

snippet.title: Metallica Through The Never: A Story About The Motivating Power Of A Higher Purpose
snippet.description: From the beginning of Metallica’s new 3D movie, Metallica Through the Never, viewers enter a universe where things go terribly wrong. Making them right again hinges on the dedication of those who love the band and its music. read »

snippet.title: Grammy Nominations 2014: The Full List
snippet.description: The nominations have been announced for the 56th Annual Grammy Awards, with Jay Z's nine nods leading the pack. Four acts garnered seven nominations apiece: Kendrick Lamar, Pharrell Williams, Justin Timberlake and Macklemore & Ryan Lewis. But there are plenty more superstars--and lesser-known but stupendously talented musicians--among the [...]

snippet.title: Ten Things You Can't Miss in New York City Before Summer Is Over
snippet.description: Summer in New York City goes by way too fast for most of us. But there are still more than two months left of sunshine and literally thousands of events in music, art, fashion, nightlife, food and sports that are perfect for visitors and locals. Yes there's more construction and [...] read »

snippet.title: The Best "Sleeper Ideas" For Trends, Stocks, And Private Companies To Watch In 2014
snippet.description: I asked 55 of the smartest people I know to give me their top 3 "sleeper ideas" for 2014 - the ones that would really surprise us when we look back on the year next December. Thoughts from VCs, Hedge Fund people, traders, entrpreneurs and analysts are contained within. read »
